snippet: A gift horse or a Trojan horse? That about summed up the latest, almost farcical encounter between Moscow and Kiev.
abstract: Russian convoy of some 260 trucks carrying thousands of tons of humanitarian aid for those in Ukranian city of Luhansk is met with skepticism and suspicion; Russia insists it is interested only in relieving suffering of people, but Ukraine suspects convoy may be attempt to infiltrate into country under guise of humanitarian aid.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Roth from Artemivsk, Ukraine; Andrew E. Kramer from Donetsk, Ukraine; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; Alison Smale from Berlin; and Scott Sayare from Paris.

lead_paragraph: A gift horse or a Trojan horse? That about summed up the latest, almost farcical encounter between Moscow and Kiev.

headline.main: A Russian Convoy Carrying Aid to Ukraine Is Dogged by Suspicion
headline.print_headline: A Russian Convoy Carrying Aid to Ukraine Is Dogged by Suspicion
